overview:
Eran Davidson has been Managing Partner and Chief Executive Officer of Hasso Plattner Ventures since its foundation in 2005. From 2002 to 2005 he served as CEO for ProSeed Capital Fund in Tel Aviv. Under his auspices the Technion Technology Incubator was taken over and privatized. It then went on to become the most successful technology incubator in Israel. Before working with ProSeed Eran served as the Managing Partner at Eurofund 2000 LP in Israel. From 1996 to 2000 Eran was Vice President at Inventech Industrial Ventures in Tel Aviv. ProSeed, Eurofund and Inventech are venture capital suppliers that invested in early-stage high-tech companies under Eranâ€™s direction. Most of the investments have since developed into fully mature enterprises and some are being traded on the NASDAQ and other international stock exchanges. From 1995 to 1996 Eran served as Vice President of Open Sky Ltd. and from 1991 to 1993 he headed his own law company.

Eran received his degree in Law from Tel Aviv University and holds an MBA from Boston University.
